Yun Jin Lee is a baddie

Hi,
das Spiel ist an sich super. Man kann das Gameplay relativ schnell erlernen und es macht auch mit Freunden zusammen sehr Spaß. 
ABER
DBD unternimmt nichts gegen Spielverderber, wie Tunnler, Camper, Slugger, Bodyblocker etc.
Da stellt sich die Frage, warum DBD überhaupt die Spieler dann so etwas melden lässt.
Meiner Meinung nach verdirbt einen diese Einstellung von manchen Killern, einen das Gameplay. Außerdem hat DBD auch hin und wieder Bugs.
Trotz dessen gibt es einen Custom Modus, welchen man mit seinen Freunden spielt, wo es bei unseren Runden keine Spielverderber gibt. Dies macht mir persönlich dann wieder Viel Spaß.

Muss jeder selbst wissen, ob er sich das Spiel holt.

*clueless*

This game is the one that set the stage and trend for bad asymmetrical games which sadly VHS has also done. These games could be good but most asymmetrical games just want the person playing by themselves to constantly encounter situations with zero counter play and I'll say it again like I did for VHS that this is exactly why fighting games are pretty much the last genre of game that wants any form of skill to exist so multiplayer can feel playable. I won't talk about busted perks on both sides like dead hard, circle of healing, ruin (or slowdown in general which btw BHVR could've figured out ages ago that making gens take longer would've solved this problem and opened up space for better perks that aren't super boring and uninteresting at conception in some perk boardroom meeting) and so on because you either can critically think and realize why both sides have unfun builds for either to experience. This isn't to take into account maps and the certain tiles their composed of and how that already created enough challenge for most killers outside of nurse which BHVR probably crutched on for making so many bad decisions up to this point when it comes to perk design and making killer unfun for years. Either way a this point maybe the "massive" perk nerf update will finally fix this game but with behaviors track record over the years after all those patches I wouldn't get my hopes up. Just go buy strive or any other game if you want learning to play to be a rewarding experience versus an exercise in futility especially for killer when you realize only 10 killers are actually playable on a killer roster of 28...yikes.

The game isn't bad, its fun with friends, sometimes without friends, as both killer and survivor

But for some unknown reason, matchmaking was removed (or is just bad to the point that it doesn't exist anymore)
if you play as survivor you might be against tryhard killers who will camp at every possible point.
If you play killer, you might be against tryhard who will do the generators before you even hit a single person.

so in conclusion: if you're new to the game or play only from time to time, you'll be against people that have all maxed perks, that have over 2000 hours into the game, and know strats you didn't knew existed that you can't do yourself

And also the community isn't very nice usually and will insult you at the end of the game or during the game by focusing you while forgetting about the objectives

So until matchmaking is fixed i can't recommend this game unless you play only with friends on custom lobbies

Until they find a way to balance this game its always going to fall short of great.  Is it addicting? Yes.  Is it fun? Sometimes.  Is it consistently fun? No.  If you're in a swf and have any sort of skill the game is a snoozefest. If you're playing solo queue there's two outcomes, either A) Matchmaking is in your favor, killer is playing fair and you have a really fun and balanced game. Or B) You sweat your balls off trying to stay alive and keep your team alive while gens turn into museum exhibits. These are about 30/70, so if you have good luck and like intermittent reinforcement from a game that will keep you addicted to the win/lose gamble, this is for you.

While playing the Tutorial is basically required before actually playing online, this game is a wonderful and friendly 4v1 competitive game. Once you learn how the Bloodweb and Loadout work its easy to get into. Players are very friendly. While playing with random people there is still a sense of comradery amongst the survivors.
